016package com.nickbenn.adventofcode.day5;
017
018import static com.nickbenn.adventofcode.view.Presentation.NUMERIC_SOLUTION_FORMAT;
019
020import com.nickbenn.adventofcode.model.LongRange;
021import com.nickbenn.adventofcode.util.StreamChunker;
022import com.nickbenn.adventofcode.view.DataSource;
023import java.io.IOException;
024import java.util.LinkedList;
025import java.util.List;
026import java.util.Map;
027import java.util.Map.Entry;
028import java.util.NavigableMap;
029import java.util.Objects;
030import java.util.Spliterator;
031import java.util.Spliterators;
032import java.util.TreeMap;
033import java.util.function.Predicate;
034import java.util.regex.Matcher;
035import java.util.regex.Pattern;
036import java.util.stream.Collectors;
037import java.util.stream.Stream;
038import java.util.stream.StreamSupport;
039
040/**
041 * Implements solutions for both parts of day 5, reading a line specifying seed numbers, then a
042 * sequence of mapping layers, each with one or more segments defining an input range and a
043 * corresponding output range. (An output range may be translated from the input range, but not
044 * scaled; that is, and input range and its corresponding output range have the same length.)
045 * <p>After reading the input data, parts 1 and 2 both require the same type of
046 * calculation&mdash;namely, find the lowest location value (the output from the final mapping
047 * layer) for any of the seeds specified in the first line of input. However, the two parts require
048 * different assumptions about the specification of seed numbers:</p>
049 * <ul>
050 *   <li>In part 1, every value on the first line of input is a seed number.</li>
051 *   <li>In part 2, every <em>pair</em> of values on the first line of input specifies a
052 *   starting seed number and a range length. For example, the pair of values <em>a b</em>
053 *   specifies the integral range of seed numbers <em>a</em>..(<em>b</em> - 1).</li>
054 * </ul>
055 *
056 * @see <a href="https://adventofcode.com/2023/day/5">"Day 5: If You Give A Seed A Fertilizer"</a>.
057 */
058public class SeedFertilizer {
059
060  private static final Pattern BLOCK_EXTRACTOR =
061      Pattern.compile("(?:(seeds)|[^:]*?):\\s+(.*)$", Pattern.DOTALL);
062  private static final Pattern LINE_SPLITTER = Pattern.compile("\\n");
063  private static final Pattern SEED_SPLITTER = Pattern.compile("\\s+");
064  private static final long MIN_START = 0;
065  private static final long MIN_END = Long.MAX_VALUE;
066
067  private final List<Long> seeds = new LinkedList<>();
068  private final List<LongRange> seedRanges = new LinkedList<>();
069  private final NavigableMap<Long, Mapping> mergedMap;
070
071  /**
072   * Initializes this instance, using the value of {@link DataSource#DEFAULT_INPUT_FILE} as the name
073   * (relative to the package of this class on the classpath) of the file to be read. In other
074   * words, using this constructor is equivalent to using
075   * {@link #SeedFertilizer(String) SeedFertilizer(DataSource.DEFAULT_INPUT_FILE)}.
076   *
077   * @throws IOException If the file referenced by {@link DataSource#DEFAULT_INPUT_FILE}} cannot be
078   *                     found or read.
079   */
080  public SeedFertilizer() throws IOException {
081    this(DataSource.DEFAULT_INPUT_FILE);
082  }
083
084  /**
085   * Initializes this instance, using the value specified in the {@code inputFile} parameter as the
086   * name (relative to the package of this class on the classpath) of the file to be read, parsing
087   * the seed numbers at the start of the file, then parsing each successive block of lines as a
088   * series of corresponding input and output ranges, together forming a mapping layer.
089   * <p>Implementation notes:</p>
090   * <ul>
091   *   <li>Each mapping layer is normalized, filling in the gaps in the input layer, resulting in
092   *   a continuous set of input segments, covering the range <code>0..(Long.MAX_VALUE - 1)</code>.
093   *   </li>
094   *   <li>The individual layers are not maintained in the instance state; instead, after
095   *   normalization, each layer is merged into a reduced result obtained to that point. The merging
096   *   process replaces each segment in the merged layer produced to that point with one or more
097   *   segments formed from the intersections of the output range of the given segment with the
098   *   input ranges of the layer being merged.</li>
099   *   <li>The layer merging described above starts with a seed layer consisting of a single
100   *   segment, with identical input and output ranges of <code>0..(Long.MAX_VALUE - 1)</code>.</li>
101   * </ul>
102   *
103   * @param inputFile Classpath/package-relative location of file from which input is read.
104   * @throws IOException If the file referenced by {@code inputFile} cannot be found or read.
105   */
106  public SeedFertilizer(String inputFile) throws IOException {
107    try (Stream<String> blocks = new DataSource.Builder(this)
108        .setInputFile(inputFile)
109        .build()
110        .paragraphs()) {
111      mergedMap = blocks
112          .map(BLOCK_EXTRACTOR::matcher)
113          .filter(Matcher::matches)
114          .map((matcher) -> {
115            String data = matcher.group(2);
116            if (matcher.group(1) != null) {
117              seeds.addAll(getSeeds(data));
118              seedRanges.addAll(getRanges(seeds));
119              return null;
120            }
121            return data;
122          })
123          .filter(Predicate.not(Objects::isNull))
124          .map(this::getMap)
125          .map(this::normalize)
126          .reduce(new TreeMap<>(Map.of(MIN_START, new Mapping(MIN_START, MIN_START, MIN_END))),
127              this::merge);
128    }
129  }
130
131  /**
132   * For each of parts 1 and 2, creates an instance of {@link SeedFertilizer}, invokes the relevant
133   * solution method, and prints the result.
134   *
135   * @param args Command-line arguments (currently ignored).
136   * @throws IOException If the file referenced by {@link DataSource#DEFAULT_INPUT_FILE}} cannot be
137   *                     found or read.
138   */
139  public static void main(String[] args) throws IOException {
140    SeedFertilizer seedFertilizer = new SeedFertilizer();
141    System.out.printf(NUMERIC_SOLUTION_FORMAT, 1, seedFertilizer.getLowestLocation());
142    System.out.printf(NUMERIC_SOLUTION_FORMAT, 2, seedFertilizer.getLowestInterpolatedLocation());
143  }
144
145  /**
146   * Computes and returns the lowest final location number resulting for any of the seed numbers
147   * explicitly listed at the start of the input.
148   * <p>This method does not modify the state of the instance or have any other side effects.</p>
149   */
150  public long getLowestLocation() {
151    return seeds
152        .stream()
153        .mapToLong((seed) -> {
154          Mapping mapping = mergedMap.floorEntry(seed).getValue();
155          return seed + mapping.destinationStart() - mapping.sourceStart();
156        })
157        .min()
158        .orElse(MIN_END);
159  }
160
161  /**
162   * Computes and returns the lowest final location number resulting for any seed number falling in
163   * the seed number ranges listed at the start of the input.
164   * <p>Implementation notes: This process does not iterate over all of the values falling in the
165   * seed number ranges; instead, it proceeds in a similar fashion to that described for the merging
166   * performed by {@link #SeedFertilizer(String)}: Each range of seed numbers is replaced by one or
167   * more segments, each with a corresponding output range (based on the merge mapping layers).
168   * Since the lowest location value <em>must</em> occur at the start of one of these segments, it
169   * is thus a simple matter to compute the final location value for the seed number at the start of
170   * each segment, and take the lowest of these values.</p>
171   * <p>This method does not modify the state of the instance or have any other side effects.</p>
172   */
173  public long getLowestInterpolatedLocation() {
174    return seedRanges
175        .stream()
176        .flatMap((range) -> {
177          long start = range.start();
178          long length = range.length();
179          Mapping base = new Mapping(start, start, length);
180          return segments(base, mergedMap);
181        })
182        .mapToLong(Mapping::destinationStart)
183        .min()
184        .orElse(MIN_END);
185  }
186
187  private List<Long> getSeeds(String data) {
188    return SEED_SPLITTER
189        .splitAsStream(data)
190        .map(String::strip)
191        .filter(Predicate.not(String::isEmpty))
192        .map(Long::valueOf)
193        .collect(Collectors.toList());
194  }
195
196  private List<LongRange> getRanges(List<Long> seeds) {
197    return StreamSupport.stream(Spliterators.spliteratorUnknownSize(
198            new StreamChunker<>(seeds.iterator(), 2),
199            Spliterator.ORDERED | Spliterator.NONNULL | Spliterator.IMMUTABLE), false)
200        .map((Stream<Long> stream) -> stream.mapToLong(Long::longValue).toArray())
201        .map((pair) -> new LongRange(pair[0], pair[1]))
202        .collect(Collectors.toList());
203  }
204
205  private NavigableMap<Long, Mapping> getMap(String data) {
206    NavigableMap<Long, Mapping> map = new TreeMap<>();
207    LINE_SPLITTER
208        .splitAsStream(data)
209        .map(String::strip)
210        .map(Mapping::parse)
211        .forEach((mapping) -> map.put(mapping.sourceStart(), mapping));
212    return map;
213  }
214
215  private NavigableMap<Long, Mapping> normalize(NavigableMap<Long, Mapping> map) {
216    long sourceStart = MIN_START;
217    do {
218      Entry<Long, Mapping> entry = map.ceilingEntry(sourceStart);
219      if (entry != null) {
220        long entryStart = entry.getKey();
221        long entryLength = entry.getValue().length();
222        if (entryStart > sourceStart) {
223          map.put(sourceStart, new Mapping(sourceStart, sourceStart, entryStart - sourceStart));
224        }
225        sourceStart = entryStart + entryLength;
226      } else if (sourceStart < MIN_END) {
227        map.put(sourceStart, new Mapping(sourceStart, sourceStart, MIN_END - sourceStart));
228        break;
229      } else {
230        break;
231      }
232    } while (true);
233    return map;
234  }
235
236  private NavigableMap<Long, Mapping> merge(NavigableMap<Long, Mapping> input,
237      NavigableMap<Long, Mapping> output) {
238    NavigableMap<Long, Mapping> merged = new TreeMap<>();
239    input
240        .values()
241        .stream()
242        .flatMap((mapping) -> segments(mapping, output))
243        .forEach((mapping) -> merged.put(mapping.sourceStart(), mapping));
244    return merged;
245  }
246
247  private Stream<Mapping> segments(Mapping base, NavigableMap<Long, Mapping> map) {
248    long destinationStart = base.destinationStart();
249    long destinationEnd = base.destinationEnd();
250    long delta = base.delta();
251    return map
252        .headMap(destinationEnd, false)
253        .entrySet()
254        .stream()
255        .dropWhile((entry) -> entry.getKey() + entry.getValue().length() <= destinationStart)
256        .map((entry) -> {
257          Mapping layer = entry.getValue();
258          long layerDelta = layer.delta();
259          long newDestinationStart = Math.max(destinationStart, layer.sourceStart()) + layerDelta;
260          long newDestinationEnd = Math.min(destinationEnd, layer.sourceEnd()) + layerDelta;
261          long newLength = newDestinationEnd - newDestinationStart;
262          long newSourceStart = newDestinationStart - delta - layerDelta;
263          return new Mapping(newDestinationStart, newSourceStart, newLength);
264        });
265  }
266
267  private record Mapping(long destinationStart, long sourceStart, long length) {
268
269    private static final Pattern MAPPING_EXTRACTOR =
270        Pattern.compile("\\s*(\\d+)\\s+(\\d+)\\s+(\\d+)\\s*");
271
272    public long delta() {
273      return destinationStart - sourceStart;
274    }
275
276    public long sourceEnd() {
277      return sourceStart + length;
278    }
279
280    public long destinationEnd() {
281      return destinationStart + length;
282    }
283
284    public static Mapping parse(String input) {
285      Matcher matcher = MAPPING_EXTRACTOR.matcher(input);
286      if (!matcher.matches()) {
287        throw new IllegalArgumentException();
288      }
289      return new Mapping(Long.parseLong(matcher.group(1)), Long.parseLong(matcher.group(2)),
290          Long.parseLong(matcher.group(3)));
291    }
292
293  }
294
295}
